org.tigr.antware.shared.util
Class IniReader

java.lang.Object
  org.tigr.antware.shared.util.IniReader

public class IniReader
extends Object

This class can read configuration files that are in '.ini' file format and provides an interface to read string, integer and boolean values.

Presently this class provides limited support of INI files. It does not support groups yet.

The ".ini" files have various sections each marked by the section name in square brackets. Each section name must be unique and can contain one or more properties specified as a property-value pair one per line. Each section has its own namespace, therefore two sections can have the same property name. When a property has multiple values, the values are either specified as a comma separated list, or as multiple occurences of the param in that section.

The following is a typical example of an INI style file: 

 ; a comment about the default section
 [default]
 logfile=myfile.log
 loglevel=3

 ; A comment about the application section
 [application]
 inputfile=infile.dat
 filter=GB,SP
 filter=PIR

findSeparator

private int findSeparator(String p_value,
                          int p_searchStart)
                   throws DataFormatErrorException
The method findSeparator returns the terminator position for the passed string starting from the search start location. If the string does not have a separator then the method returns -1

Parameters:
p_p_value -
p_start -
Returns:
an int representing the location of the separator code, -1 if there is no separator
Throws:
DataFormatErrorException

addValue

public void addValue(Map sectionMap,
                     String param,
                     String value)
              throws DataFormatErrorException
The addValue method adds the specified param and its associated value to the hash. If the parent hash already contains an entry for this param then the new value is appended to the list of values, if the parent does not contain the param then an entry is made for the param. The value can be a single value, or multiple values specified as a comma separated string. In the latter case individual values are added to the list.

Parameters:
sectionMap - a Map that should hold the param
param - a String value representing the compound param. Only the last part of the compound param is used
value - a String representing the value for the param. It can be a single value or a comma separated list.
Throws:
DataFormatErrorException

setValue

private void setValue(Map sectionMap,
                      String param,
                      String[] newValues)
The method setValue sets the value for the specified param in the specified section. The values are specified as an array of values. If the array has more than one value then the values are added as vector.

Parameters:
sectionMap -
param -
newValues - a

setValue

public void setValue(Map sectionMap,
                     String param,
                     String value)
              throws DataFormatErrorException
The method setValue sets the value for the specified param in the specified section. The values are specified as a comma separated list of values for multiple values.

Parameters:
sectionMap -
param -
value - a
Throws:
DataFormatErrorException

initialize

private void initialize(String iniFile)
                 throws IOException,
                        InvalidFileFormatException,
                        DataFormatErrorException
The initialize method reads the data from the INI style configuration file and builds the iniMap hash.

The section headers form the param of the hash and the value is another hash of the parameters of the section. Each section name should be unique.

Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs reading the data
InvalidFileFormatException
DataFormatErrorException

getValue

public Object getValue(String section,
                       String parameter,
                       Object value)
The getValue method returns the value object associated with the specified parameter in the specified section.

Parameters:
section - a String representing the section
parameter - a String representing the parameter
value - an Object that represents the default value if the section does not contain an entry for the specified param
Returns:
an Object associated with the parameter, null if this section does not have the parameter.

Returns:
an Object associated with the parameter, null if this section does not have the parameter.

getValueString

public String getValueString(String section,
                             String param,
                             String defaultValue)
The getValueString method returns the value as a string for the specified section and param. If the param does not exist, it returns the default value. If the value contains multiple values, the list is returned as a comma separated list

Parameters:
section - a String value representing the section name
param - a String value representing the param
defaultValue - a String value representing the default value
Returns:
a String value representing the value for the specified param

getValueVector

public Vector getValueVector(String section,
                             String param)
The getValueVector method returns the value or values associated with the specified param and section as list.

Parameters:
section - a String value representing the section name
param - a String value representing the param
Returns:
a Vector containing the value or values associated with this parameter. If this param does not exist, then the method returns an empty list.

getSections

public Collection getSections()
The getSections method returns a list of iniMap in this INI file.

Returns:
a Collection representing the iniMap in this file

a Map representing the sections in the file
